trainingRecap: Attacking – Make well-timed diagonal or vertical runs in behind to challenge depth and disrupt shape.
Attacking - Play Through, Around or Over; Break lines by choosing the most effective route based on space, numbers, and pressure

gameModel.attackingOrganization: Break lines through, around, or over. Move beyond, below, and beside the ball to create options. Be composed, fast, and sharp.
gameModel.defensiveOrganization: Press high when we can. In our half, stay compact. In the box: fill space, find your mark, and clear big. Everyone defends.
gameModel.defensiveTransition: React fast, recover hard, regroup quickly. Win it back or slow them down.
gameModel.attackingTransition: Secure the ball first. If the break is on, go fast. If not, keep it and build with control.

videoReview.note: Good combination play and effective interactions to progress the ball forward.
Good intent from our CB to target the space behind their RCB and RB, matched by a smart run in behind from our attacking mid
Box defending: 2Fs — Fill the space, Find your mark. No free players. This is everyone’s job — defenders, midfielders tracking back, all working together. Take ownership.

trainingRecap: Defending - Prevent Forward Play by denying passing lanes
Performance Mentality – 3Ps of Pressing: Press with Pace, Power and Purpose.

videoReview.note: Good build-up —finding the free player and looking to play in behind the defenders.
We can’t allow a 2v1 on corners—let’s make sure we match numbers and don’t get caught in an underload
We allowed them to play through, but great recognition from our CM to step up and press, stopping the play

videoReview.note: After winning the ball, look to progress quickly and exploit the spaces before the opponent can recover. Attack with speed whenever the opportunity is there.

trainingRecap: In our half, mid-low block: stay compact, close the gaps, move as one. Protect the space, control the threat.

videoReview.note: Sockers FC Goal – High Press & Transition: They score by pressing high, forcing a turnover, and attacking quickly — so we must react immediately after losing the ball, delay in 1v1s, and stay disciplined to avoid getting beaten in the box.
Sockers FC looks to build from the back, so we establish our 3-3-4 press to win the ball high and attack quickly.

trainingRecap: Defensive organization — In the 4-2-3-1, we focused on high pressing principles and shifting into a compact mid-block. Emphasis was on pressing triggers, vertical and horizontal compactness, and maintaining overall team shape.

trainingRecap: This week we focused on our back four and overall defensive organization in our own half — emphasizing compactness, communication, and coordinated movement when stepping or dropping. In defensive transitions, we worked on the three R’s: react, recover, and regroup to quickly restore our team shape.

trainingRecap: This week’s focus was on threatening the last line through counter movements — players running in different directions to pull defenders out of position while others make runs in behind. We also worked on recognizing when to commit defenders or combine with teammates to create goal-scoring opportunities.
